SAN FRANCISCO
EW YORK
You haven't seen anything
'til youve seen
South America
SANTIAGO
PORT OF SPAIN
* LA PAZ
... and now its cool there-
the ideal time to skytour both coasts
with Pan American and Panagra
WHERE EISE ON EARTH can you pack this much variely
into as little as two weeks' vacation? Mountain lake
country, seaside resorts ... quaint villages, modern
cities .. 2,000-year-old archeological wonders, ex-
citing night clubs ... luxurious hotels, low prices!
Moreover, when you cross the Equator, you trade
summer heat in the States for 50° and 60° temperatures
in South America at this time of year.
You can fly to 7 amazing cities only a few hours
apart by deluxe air-conditioned DC-6 type airliners.
Pan American Super-6 Clippers* fly the East Coast from
New York to Buenos Aires. El Inter Americano DC-6's fly
from "B.A." to Miami via Panagra's West Coast route.
Berths available at modest charge.
First-class fare from New York is $988.20 round trip
in either direction. Similar fares from any major air-
port in the U.S. A., via New York, Miami, New Orleans,
Houston or Los Angeles. Savings up to 20% on tourist
service by pressurized planes flying 'round South
America. Call your Travel Agent or Pan American.
No sweltering heat here! Buenos Aires is
springlike this time of year-
-perfect for sight-
seeing. Standing inside the portico of Casa
Rosada (above), office of the Argentine presi-
dent. you look north on Avenida de Mayo,
lined with handsome buildings. "B.A." is the
"Paris of South America" and when you fly,
it's only a dav from the U.S.A. Think of it!
You can taste succulent Argentine steaks to-
MOTTOW
-for as little as 25¢ to 50é.
Fly
PANAGRA
O PAN
AMERICAN-GRACE
AIRWAYS
and
Golf at Montevideo where velvety green fairways run along the
water's edge. Guest cards may be arranged through the local Pan
American office. Besides golf, fishing and sailing, the "City of Roses"
offers fashionable race tracks and gambling casinos. Also, fine sym-
phony concerts featuring world-famous conductors and soloists.
*Trade-Mark, Reg. U.S. Pat. Off.
PAN AMERICAN
PAN AMERICAN WORLD AIRWAYS
HOLIDAY AUGUST
properties.sfomuseum:description: Advertisement from August 1953 issue of Holiday promoting Pan American World Airways, titled “You haven’t seen anything ‘til you’ve seen South America / Fly Panagra and Pan American” with small route map of North and South America and images of Buenos Aires and Montevideo.
